result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

The defendant Keisha Marie Piff-Gregoire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: see attached DEJ agreement scanned into the court record.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: All financials placed on payment plan $20 biweekly through income assignment
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present or consumed.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
Joint and severally liable with Blake Mueller

timeConds.notes:
Zero credit for time served.
Def to contact Ashland County Jail within 7 days to set up time to begin serving sentence. 
Granted Work Release 
Granted Child Care Release
Jail time MAY be replaced by completing 160 hours of Community Service within 4 months. Written proof is to be submitted to the Court, the Department of Corrections, the Ashland County Jail, the Ashland County Clerk of Courts office, and the Ashland County District Attorney's office on the letterhead of the nonprofit agency for which the service was performed. Partial credit will not be given.

Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement

Defendant Keisha Marie Piff-Gregoire in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty. Kelly Mcknight  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information has been filed. deferred entry of judgment agreement. Ct would like paragraph 3 filled in on the blank. plea to both charges deferred entry of judgment agreement on ct 13. Deferred entry represent the complete agreement. CT 13 party to crime of burglary.  ct 14 party to crime of theft. Pleas NC to each ct. signed plea questionnaire and deferred entry of agreement, understand documents. no threat or force to plea no contest. no mind altering substances. understands elements of each crime. wants ct to accept pleas and agreement. Ct finds pleas of NC have been know and vol given. Ct accepts pleas and finds G each ct. State complied with victim rights. Def does not have a prior record. if she successfully completes deferred agreement the burglary charge. expungement it not up for decision.  DA states agreement is fair. The deferred agreement goes with her help with information she gave to help unsolved agreement. Expungement is not an option. Rafferty makes comments about the facts. Def and Mueller had a relationship. Def is now working. Def has moved forward. Def states that she is more then sorry, was in a bad place and is picking her life back up. Ct comments in regard to guilt- yes def is guilty. culpability  is a little different. remorse is there. some jail time would hold her accountable for her crimes and she could serve on the monitor. CT 14 sent is withheld probation  for 12 months. report to office in Ashland within 24 hrs. 20 days jail or community serve all documation  served to COurt DA within 4 months on letterhead from agencies  where completed. Grant her work release and child care release. order within 1 week contact sheriff office to set up jail time and DNA. Rest $ 840. joint and serve with blake muleler. AODA ABSOl, no possess or consume mind alter, pres as pres, no place where mind altering substances are consumed or present. random testing counseling, $499.38. and $35 service fees all payments made at the COC office. Working at Dollar tree in Ashland, paid every 2 weeks. $20 every 2 weeks out of paycheck----COC do order--- consider the terms of the agreement. comply and complete Probation. everything has to be paid within 12 months. money goes to rest first then other obligations - this agreement states must pay fee at the DA office. Ct accepts deferred agreement. Sentence credit is zero.
